instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Protocol.Protocol
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Protocol.Protocol
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Protocol.Protocol
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Protocol.Protocol


module Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Listener

-- | A complex type for a listener.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListener</a> smart constructor.
data Listener
Listener' :: Maybe (NonEmpty PortRange) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Protocol -> Maybe ClientAffinity -> Listener

-- | The list of port ranges for the connections from clients to the
--   accelerator.
[$sel:portRanges:Listener'] :: Listener -> Maybe (NonEmpty PortRange)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.
[$sel:listenerArn:Listener'] :: Listener -> Maybe Text

-- | The protocol for the connections from clients to the accelerator.
[$sel:protocol:Listener'] :: Listener -> Maybe Protocol

-- | Client affinity lets you direct all requests from a user to the same
--   endpoint, if you have stateful applications, regardless of the port
--   and protocol of the client request. Client affinity gives you control
--   over whether to always route each client to the same specific
--   endpoint.
--   
--   AWS Global Accelerator uses a consistent-flow hashing algorithm to
--   choose the optimal endpoint for a connection. If client affinity is
--   <tt>NONE</tt>, Global Accelerator uses the "five-tuple" (5-tuple)
--   properties—source IP address, source port, destination IP address,
--   destination port, and protocol—to select the hash value, and then
--   chooses the best endpoint. However, with this setting, if someone uses
--   different ports to connect to Global Accelerator, their connections
--   might not be always routed to the same endpoint because the hash value
--   changes.
--   
--   If you want a given client to always be routed to the same endpoint,
--   set client affinity to <tt>SOURCE_IP</tt> instead. When you use the
--   <tt>SOURCE_IP</tt> setting, Global Accelerator uses the "two-tuple"
--   (2-tuple) properties— source (client) IP address and destination IP
--   address—to select the hash value.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>NONE</tt>.
[$sel:clientAffinity:Listener'] :: Listener -> Maybe ClientAffinity

-- | Create a value of <a>Listener</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:portRanges:Listener'</a>, <a>listener_portRanges</a> - The
--   list of port ranges for the connections from clients to the
--   accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listenerArn:Listener'</a>, <a>listener_listenerArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:Listener'</a>, <a>listener_protocol</a> - The
--   protocol for the connections from clients to the accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientAffinity:Listener'</a>, <a>listener_clientAffinity</a> -
--   Client affinity lets you direct all requests from a user to the same
--   endpoint, if you have stateful applications, regardless of the port
--   and protocol of the client request. Client affinity gives you control
--   over whether to always route each client to the same specific
--   endpoint.
--   
--   AWS Global Accelerator uses a consistent-flow hashing algorithm to
--   choose the optimal endpoint for a connection. If client affinity is
--   <tt>NONE</tt>, Global Accelerator uses the "five-tuple" (5-tuple)
--   properties—source IP address, source port, destination IP address,
--   destination port, and protocol—to select the hash value, and then
--   chooses the best endpoint. However, with this setting, if someone uses
--   different ports to connect to Global Accelerator, their connections
--   might not be always routed to the same endpoint because the hash value
--   changes.
--   
--   If you want a given client to always be routed to the same endpoint,
--   set client affinity to <tt>SOURCE_IP</tt> instead. When you use the
--   <tt>SOURCE_IP</tt> setting, Global Accelerator uses the "two-tuple"
--   (2-tuple) properties— source (client) IP address and destination IP
--   address—to select the hash value.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>NONE</tt>.
newListener :: Listener

-- | The list of port ranges for the connections from clients to the
--   accelerator.
listener_portRanges :: Lens' Listener (Maybe (NonEmpty PortRange))

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.
listener_listenerArn :: Lens' Listener (Maybe Text)

-- | The protocol for the connections from clients to the accelerator.
listener_protocol :: Lens' Listener (Maybe Protocol)

-- | Client affinity lets you direct all requests from a user to the same
--   endpoint, if you have stateful applications, regardless of the port
--   and protocol of the client request. Client affinity gives you control
--   over whether to always route each client to the same specific
--   endpoint.
--   
--   AWS Global Accelerator uses a consistent-flow hashing algorithm to
--   choose the optimal endpoint for a connection. If client affinity is
--   <tt>NONE</tt>, Global Accelerator uses the "five-tuple" (5-tuple)
--   properties—source IP address, source port, destination IP address,
--   destination port, and protocol—to select the hash value, and then
--   chooses the best endpoint. However, with this setting, if someone uses
--   different ports to connect to Global Accelerator, their connections
--   might not be always routed to the same endpoint because the hash value
--   changes.
--   
--   If you want a given client to always be routed to the same endpoint,
--   set client affinity to <tt>SOURCE_IP</tt> instead. When you use the
--   <tt>SOURCE_IP</tt> setting, Global Accelerator uses the "two-tuple"
--   (2-tuple) properties— source (client) IP address and destination IP
--   address—to select the hash value.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>NONE</tt>.
listener_clientAffinity :: Lens' Listener (Maybe ClientAffinity)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Listener.Listener
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Listener.Listener
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Listener.Listener
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Listener.Listener
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Listener.Listener
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Listener.Listener
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Listener.Listener


module Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription

-- | For a custom routing accelerator, describes the port range and
--   protocol for all endpoints (virtual private cloud subnets) in an
--   endpoint group to accept client traffic on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingDestinationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CustomRoutingDestinationDescription
CustomRoutingDestinationDescription' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Protocol] -> Maybe Natural -> CustomRoutingDestinationDescription

-- | The first port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint
--   group that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
[$sel:fromPort:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The protocol for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom
--   routing accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
[$sel:protocols:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationDescription -> Maybe [Protocol]

-- | The last port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group
--   that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
[$sel:toPort:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingDestinationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromPort:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingDestinationDescription_fromPort</a> - The first port,
--   inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group that is
--   associated with a custom routing accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocols:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingDestinationDescription_protocols</a> - The protocol
--   for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom routing
--   accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toPort:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingDestinationDescription_toPort</a> - The last port,
--   inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group that is
--   associated with a custom routing accelerator.
newCustomRoutingDestinationDescription :: CustomRoutingDestinationDescription

-- | The first port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint
--   group that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
customRoutingDestinationDescription_fromPort :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | The protocol for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom
--   routing accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
customRoutingDestinationDescription_protocols :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationDescription (Maybe [Protocol])

-- | The last port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group
--   that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
customRoutingDestinationDescription_toPort :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationDescription (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription.CustomRoutingDestinationDescription


module Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup

-- | A complex type for the endpoint group for a custom routing
--   accelerator. An AWS Region can have only one endpoint group for a
--   specific listener.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingEndpointGroup</a> smart constructor.
data CustomRoutingEndpointGroup
CustomRoutingEndpointGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CustomRoutingEndpointDescription] -> Maybe [CustomRoutingDestinationDescription] -> CustomRoutingEndpointGroup

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.
[$sel:endpointGroupArn:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS Region where the endpoint group is located.
[$sel:endpointGroupRegion:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | For a custom routing accelerator, describes the endpoints (virtual
--   private cloud subnets) in an endpoint group to accept client traffic
--   on.
[$sel:endpointDescriptions:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup -> Maybe [CustomRoutingEndpointDescription]

-- | For a custom routing accelerator, describes the port range and
--   protocol for all endpoints (virtual private cloud subnets) in an
--   endpoint group to accept client traffic on.
[$sel:destinationDescriptions:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup -> Maybe [CustomRoutingDestinationDescription]

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingEndpointGroup</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointGroupArn:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingEndpointGroup_endpointGroupArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointGroupRegion:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingEndpointGroup_endpointGroupRegion</a> - The AWS Region
--   where the endpoint group is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointDescriptions:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingEndpointGroup_endpointDescriptions</a> - For a custom
--   routing accelerator, describes the endpoints (virtual private cloud
--   subnets) in an endpoint group to accept client traffic on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationDescriptions:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingEndpointGroup_destinationDescriptions</a> - For a
--   custom routing accelerator, describes the port range and protocol for
--   all endpoints (virtual private cloud subnets) in an endpoint group to
--   accept client traffic on.
newCustomRoutingEndpointGroup :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.
customRoutingEndpointGroup_endpointGroupArn :: Lens' CustomRoutingEndpointGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Region where the endpoint group is located.
customRoutingEndpointGroup_endpointGroupRegion :: Lens' CustomRoutingEndpointGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | For a custom routing accelerator, describes the endpoints (virtual
--   private cloud subnets) in an endpoint group to accept client traffic
--   on.
customRoutingEndpointGroup_endpointDescriptions :: Lens' CustomRoutingEndpointGroup (Maybe [CustomRoutingEndpointDescription])

-- | For a custom routing accelerator, describes the port range and
--   protocol for all endpoints (virtual private cloud subnets) in an
--   endpoint group to accept client traffic on.
customRoutingEndpointGroup_destinationDescriptions :: Lens' CustomRoutingEndpointGroup (Maybe [CustomRoutingDestinationDescription])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup.CustomRoutingEndpointGroup


module Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.SocketAddress

-- | An IP address/port combination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSocketAddress</a> smart constructor.
data SocketAddress
SocketAddress' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> SocketAddress

-- | The IP address for the socket address.
[$sel:ipAddress:SocketAddress'] :: SocketAddress -> Maybe Text

-- | The port for the socket address.
[$sel:port:SocketAddress'] :: SocketAddress -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>SocketAddress</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddress:SocketAddress'</a>, <a>socketAddress_ipAddress</a> -
--   The IP address for the socket address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:SocketAddress'</a>, <a>socketAddress_port</a> - The port
--   for the socket address.
newSocketAddress :: SocketAddress

-- | The IP address for the socket address.
socketAddress_ipAddress :: Lens' SocketAddress (Maybe Text)

-- | The port for the socket address.
socketAddress_port :: Lens' SocketAddress (Maybe Natural)

module Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.PortMapping

-- | Returns the ports and associated IP addresses and ports of Amazon EC2
--   instances in your virtual private cloud (VPC) subnets. Custom routing
--   is a port mapping protocol in AWS Global Accelerator that statically
--   associates port ranges with VPC subnets, which allows Global
--   Accelerator to route to specific instances and ports within one or
--   more subnets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPortMapping</a> smart constructor.
data PortMapping
PortMapping' :: Maybe SocketAddress -> Maybe (NonEmpty CustomRoutingProtocol) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState -> Maybe Natural -> PortMapping

-- | The EC2 instance IP address and port number in the virtual private
--   cloud (VPC) subnet.
[$sel:destinationSocketAddress:PortMapping'] :: PortMapping -> Maybe SocketAddress

-- | The protocols supported by the endpoint group.
[$sel:protocols:PortMapping'] :: PortMapping -> Maybe (NonEmpty CustomRoutingProtocol)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.
[$sel:endpointGroupArn:PortMapping'] :: PortMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address of the VPC subnet (the subnet ID).
[$sel:endpointId:PortMapping'] :: PortMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether or not a port mapping destination can receive
--   traffic. The value is either ALLOW, if traffic is allowed to the
--   destination, or DENY, if traffic is not allowed to the destination.
[$sel:destinationTrafficState:PortMapping'] :: PortMapping -> Maybe CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState

-- | The accelerator port.
[$sel:acceleratorPort:PortMapping'] :: PortMapping -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>PortMapping</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationSocketAddress:PortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>portMapping_destinationSocketAddress</a> - The EC2 instance IP
--   address and port number in the virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocols:PortMapping'</a>, <a>portMapping_protocols</a> - The
--   protocols supported by the endpoint group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointGroupArn:PortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>portMapping_endpointGroupArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the endpoint group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointId:PortMapping'</a>, <a>portMapping_endpointId</a> -
--   The IP address of the VPC subnet (the subnet ID).
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationTrafficState:PortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>portMapping_destinationTrafficState</a> - Indicates whether or not
--   a port mapping destination can receive traffic. The value is either
--   ALLOW, if traffic is allowed to the destination, or DENY, if traffic
--   is not allowed to the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceleratorPort:PortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>portMapping_acceleratorPort</a> - The accelerator port.
newPortMapping :: PortMapping

-- | The EC2 instance IP address and port number in the virtual private
--   cloud (VPC) subnet.
portMapping_destinationSocketAddress :: Lens' PortMapping (Maybe SocketAddress)

-- | The protocols supported by the endpoint group.
portMapping_protocols :: Lens' PortMapping (Maybe (NonEmpty CustomRoutingProtocol))

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.
portMapping_endpointGroupArn :: Lens' PortMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address of the VPC subnet (the subnet ID).
portMapping_endpointId :: Lens' PortMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether or not a port mapping destination can receive
--   traffic. The value is either ALLOW, if traffic is allowed to the
--   destination, or DENY, if traffic is not allowed to the destination.
portMapping_destinationTrafficState :: Lens' PortMapping (Maybe CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState)

-- | The accelerator port.
portMapping_acceleratorPort :: Lens' PortMapping (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.PortMapping.PortMapping
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.PortMapping.PortMapping
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.PortMapping.PortMapping
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.PortMapping.PortMapping
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.PortMapping.PortMapping
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.PortMapping.PortMapping
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.PortMapping.PortMapping


module Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.DestinationPortMapping

-- | The port mappings for a specified endpoint IP address (destination).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestinationPortMapping</a> smart constructor.
data DestinationPortMapping
DestinationPortMapping' :: Maybe SocketAddress -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe [SocketAddress] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState -> DestinationPortMapping

-- | The endpoint IP address/port combination for traffic received on the
--   accelerator socket address.
[$sel:destinationSocketAddress:DestinationPortMapping'] :: DestinationPortMapping -> Maybe SocketAddress

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom routing accelerator that
--   you have port mappings for.
[$sel:acceleratorArn:DestinationPortMapping'] :: DestinationPortMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.
[$sel:endpointGroupArn:DestinationPortMapping'] :: DestinationPortMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS Region for the endpoint group.
[$sel:endpointGroupRegion:DestinationPortMapping'] :: DestinationPortMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address type, which must be IPv4.
[$sel:ipAddressType:DestinationPortMapping'] :: DestinationPortMapping -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | The IP address/port combinations (sockets) that map to a given
--   destination socket address.
[$sel:acceleratorSocketAddresses:DestinationPortMapping'] :: DestinationPortMapping -> Maybe [SocketAddress]

-- | The ID for the virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet.
[$sel:endpointId:DestinationPortMapping'] :: DestinationPortMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether or not a port mapping destination can receive
--   traffic. The value is either ALLOW, if traffic is allowed to the
--   destination, or DENY, if traffic is not allowed to the destination.
[$sel:destinationTrafficState:DestinationPortMapping'] :: DestinationPortMapping -> Maybe CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState

-- | Create a value of <a>DestinationPortMapping</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationSocketAddress:DestinationPortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>destinationPortMapping_destinationSocketAddress</a> - The endpoint
--   IP address/port combination for traffic received on the accelerator
--   socket address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceleratorArn:DestinationPortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>destinationPortMapping_acceleratorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the custom routing accelerator that you have port
--   mappings for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointGroupArn:DestinationPortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>destinationPortMapping_endpointGroupArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointGroupRegion:DestinationPortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>destinationPortMapping_endpointGroupRegion</a> - The AWS Region for
--   the endpoint group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressType:DestinationPortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>destinationPortMapping_ipAddressType</a> - The IP address type,
--   which must be IPv4.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceleratorSocketAddresses:DestinationPortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>destinationPortMapping_acceleratorSocketAddresses</a> - The IP
--   address/port combinations (sockets) that map to a given destination
--   socket address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointId:DestinationPortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>destinationPortMapping_endpointId</a> - The ID for the virtual
--   private cloud (VPC) subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationTrafficState:DestinationPortMapping'</a>,
--   <a>destinationPortMapping_destinationTrafficState</a> - Indicates
--   whether or not a port mapping destination can receive traffic. The
--   value is either ALLOW, if traffic is allowed to the destination, or
--   DENY, if traffic is not allowed to the destination.
newDestinationPortMapping :: DestinationPortMapping

-- | The endpoint IP address/port combination for traffic received on the
--   accelerator socket address.
destinationPortMapping_destinationSocketAddress :: Lens' DestinationPortMapping (Maybe SocketAddress)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom routing accelerator that
--   you have port mappings for.
destinationPortMapping_acceleratorArn :: Lens' DestinationPortMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.
destinationPortMapping_endpointGroupArn :: Lens' DestinationPortMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Region for the endpoint group.
destinationPortMapping_endpointGroupRegion :: Lens' DestinationPortMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address type, which must be IPv4.
destinationPortMapping_ipAddressType :: Lens' DestinationPortMapping (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | The IP address/port combinations (sockets) that map to a given
--   destination socket address.
destinationPortMapping_acceleratorSocketAddresses :: Lens' DestinationPortMapping (Maybe [SocketAddress])

-- | The ID for the virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet.
destinationPortMapping_endpointId :: Lens' DestinationPortMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether or not a port mapping destination can receive
--   traffic. The value is either ALLOW, if traffic is allowed to the
--   destination, or DENY, if traffic is not allowed to the destination.
destinationPortMapping_destinationTrafficState :: Lens' DestinationPortMapping (Maybe CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.DestinationPortMapping.DestinationPortMapping
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.DestinationPortMapping.DestinationPortMapping
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.DestinationPortMapping.DestinationPortMapping
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.DestinationPortMapping.DestinationPortMapping
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.DestinationPortMapping.DestinationPortMapping
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.DestinationPortMapping.DestinationPortMapping
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.DestinationPortMapping.DestinationPortMapping


module Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag

-- | A complex type that contains a <tt>Tag</tt> key and <tt>Tag</tt>
--   value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | A string that contains a <tt>Tag</tt> key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | A string that contains a <tt>Tag</tt> value.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A string that contains a
--   <tt>Tag</tt> key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - A string that contains a
--   <tt>Tag</tt> value.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | A string that contains a <tt>Tag</tt> key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | A string that contains a <tt>Tag</tt> value.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types.Tag.Tag


module Amazonka.GlobalAccelerator.Types

-- | API version <tt>2018-08-08</tt> of the Amazon Global Accelerator SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | You don't have access permission.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The accelerator that you specified has a listener associated with it.
--   You must remove all dependent resources from an accelerator before you
--   can delete it.
_AssociatedListenerFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The endpoint that you specified doesn't exist.
_EndpointAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An argument that you specified is invalid.
_InvalidArgumentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The listener that you specified has an endpoint group associated with
--   it. You must remove all dependent resources from a listener before you
--   can delete it.
_AssociatedEndpointGroupFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The accelerator that you specified could not be disabled.
_AcceleratorNotDisabledException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't use both of those options.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The endpoint that you specified doesn't exist.
_EndpointNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The listener that you specified doesn't exist.
_ListenerNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There isn't another item to return.
_InvalidNextTokenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There was an internal error for AWS Global Accelerator.
_InternalServiceErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The endpoint group that you specified already exists.
_EndpointGroupAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The CIDR that you specified was not found or is incorrect.
_ByoipCidrNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The CIDR that you specified is not valid for this action. For example,
--   the state of the CIDR might be incorrect for this action.
_IncorrectCidrStateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The port numbers that you specified are not valid numbers or are not
--   unique for this accelerator.
_InvalidPortRangeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The endpoint group that you specified doesn't exist.
_EndpointGroupNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The accelerator that you specified doesn't exist.
_AcceleratorNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Processing your request would cause you to exceed an AWS Global
--   Accelerator limit.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype AcceleratorStatus
AcceleratorStatus' :: Text -> AcceleratorStatus
[fromAcceleratorStatus] :: AcceleratorStatus -> Text
pattern AcceleratorStatus_DEPLOYED :: AcceleratorStatus
pattern AcceleratorStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: AcceleratorStatus
newtype ByoipCidrState
ByoipCidrState' :: Text -> ByoipCidrState
[fromByoipCidrState] :: ByoipCidrState -> Text
pattern ByoipCidrState_ADVERTISING :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_DEPROVISIONED :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_FAILED_ADVERTISING :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_FAILED_DEPROVISION :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_FAILED_PROVISION :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_FAILED_WITHDRAW :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_PENDING_ADVERTISING :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_PENDING_DEPROVISIONING :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_PENDING_PROVISIONING :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_PENDING_WITHDRAWING :: ByoipCidrState
pattern ByoipCidrState_READY :: ByoipCidrState
newtype ClientAffinity
ClientAffinity' :: Text -> ClientAffinity
[fromClientAffinity] :: ClientAffinity -> Text
pattern ClientAffinity_NONE :: ClientAffinity
pattern ClientAffinity_SOURCE_IP :: ClientAffinity
newtype CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus
CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus' :: Text -> CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus
[fromCustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus] :: CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus -> Text
pattern CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus_DEPLOYED :: CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus
pattern CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus
newtype CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState
CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState' :: Text -> CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState
[fromCustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState] :: CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState -> Text
pattern CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState_ALLOW :: CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState
pattern CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState_DENY :: CustomRoutingDestinationTrafficState
newtype CustomRoutingProtocol
CustomRoutingProtocol' :: Text -> CustomRoutingProtocol
[fromCustomRoutingProtocol] :: CustomRoutingProtocol -> Text
pattern CustomRoutingProtocol_TCP :: CustomRoutingProtocol
pattern CustomRoutingProtocol_UDP :: CustomRoutingProtocol
newtype HealthCheckProtocol
HealthCheckProtocol' :: Text -> HealthCheckProtocol
[fromHealthCheckProtocol] :: HealthCheckProtocol -> Text
pattern HealthCheckProtocol_HTTP :: HealthCheckProtocol
pattern HealthCheckProtocol_HTTPS :: HealthCheckProtocol
pattern HealthCheckProtocol_TCP :: HealthCheckProtocol
newtype HealthState
HealthState' :: Text -> HealthState
[fromHealthState] :: HealthState -> Text
pattern HealthState_HEALTHY :: HealthState
pattern HealthState_INITIAL :: HealthState
pattern HealthState_UNHEALTHY :: HealthState
newtype IpAddressType
IpAddressType' :: Text -> IpAddressType
[fromIpAddressType] :: IpAddressType -> Text
pattern IpAddressType_IPV4 :: IpAddressType
newtype Protocol
Protocol' :: Text -> Protocol
[fromProtocol] :: Protocol -> Text
pattern Protocol_TCP :: Protocol
pattern Protocol_UDP :: Protocol

-- | An accelerator is a complex type that includes one or more listeners
--   that process inbound connections and then direct traffic to one or
--   more endpoint groups, each of which includes endpoints, such as load
--   balancers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccelerator</a> smart constructor.
data Accelerator
Accelerator' :: Maybe AcceleratorStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [IpSet] -> Maybe Text -> Accelerator

-- | Describes the deployment status of the accelerator.
[$sel:status:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe AcceleratorStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the accelerator.
[$sel:acceleratorArn:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the accelerator is enabled. The value is true or
--   false. The default value is true.
--   
--   If the value is set to true, the accelerator cannot be deleted. If set
--   to false, accelerator can be deleted.
[$sel:enabled:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time that the accelerator was created.
[$sel:createdTime:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time that the accelerator was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The value for the address type must be IPv4.
[$sel:ipAddressType:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | The name of the accelerator. The name must contain only alphanumeric
--   characters or hyphens (-), and must not begin or end with a hyphen.
[$sel:name:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe Text

-- | The static IP addresses that Global Accelerator associates with the
--   accelerator.
[$sel:ipSets:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe [IpSet]

-- | The Domain Name System (DNS) name that Global Accelerator creates that
--   points to your accelerator's static IP addresses.
--   
--   The naming convention for the DNS name is the following: A lowercase
--   letter a, followed by a 16-bit random hex string, followed by
--   .awsglobalaccelerator.com. For example:
--   a1234567890abcdef.awsglobalaccelerator.com.
--   
--   For more information about the default DNS name, see <a>Support for
--   DNS Addressing in Global Accelerator</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:dnsName:Accelerator'] :: Accelerator -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Accelerator</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Accelerator'</a>, <a>accelerator_status</a> - Describes
--   the deployment status of the accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceleratorArn:Accelerator'</a>,
--   <a>accelerator_acceleratorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:Accelerator'</a>, <a>accelerator_enabled</a> -
--   Indicates whether the accelerator is enabled. The value is true or
--   false. The default value is true.
--   
--   If the value is set to true, the accelerator cannot be deleted. If set
--   to false, accelerator can be deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:Accelerator'</a>, <a>accelerator_createdTime</a> -
--   The date and time that the accelerator was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:Accelerator'</a>,
--   <a>accelerator_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time that the
--   accelerator was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressType:Accelerator'</a>,
--   <a>accelerator_ipAddressType</a> - The value for the address type must
--   be IPv4.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Accelerator'</a>, <a>accelerator_name</a> - The name of
--   the accelerator. The name must contain only alphanumeric characters or
--   hyphens (-), and must not begin or end with a hyphen.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipSets:Accelerator'</a>, <a>accelerator_ipSets</a> - The
--   static IP addresses that Global Accelerator associates with the
--   accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsName:Accelerator'</a>, <a>accelerator_dnsName</a> - The
--   Domain Name System (DNS) name that Global Accelerator creates that
--   points to your accelerator's static IP addresses.
--   
--   The naming convention for the DNS name is the following: A lowercase
--   letter a, followed by a 16-bit random hex string, followed by
--   .awsglobalaccelerator.com. For example:
--   a1234567890abcdef.awsglobalaccelerator.com.
--   
--   For more information about the default DNS name, see <a>Support for
--   DNS Addressing in Global Accelerator</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
newAccelerator :: Accelerator

-- | Describes the deployment status of the accelerator.
accelerator_status :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe AcceleratorStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the accelerator.
accelerator_acceleratorArn :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the accelerator is enabled. The value is true or
--   false. The default value is true.
--   
--   If the value is set to true, the accelerator cannot be deleted. If set
--   to false, accelerator can be deleted.
accelerator_enabled :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time that the accelerator was created.
accelerator_createdTime :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time that the accelerator was last modified.
accelerator_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value for the address type must be IPv4.
accelerator_ipAddressType :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | The name of the accelerator. The name must contain only alphanumeric
--   characters or hyphens (-), and must not begin or end with a hyphen.
accelerator_name :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe Text)

-- | The static IP addresses that Global Accelerator associates with the
--   accelerator.
accelerator_ipSets :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe [IpSet])

-- | The Domain Name System (DNS) name that Global Accelerator creates that
--   points to your accelerator's static IP addresses.
--   
--   The naming convention for the DNS name is the following: A lowercase
--   letter a, followed by a 16-bit random hex string, followed by
--   .awsglobalaccelerator.com. For example:
--   a1234567890abcdef.awsglobalaccelerator.com.
--   
--   For more information about the default DNS name, see <a>Support for
--   DNS Addressing in Global Accelerator</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
accelerator_dnsName :: Lens' Accelerator (Maybe Text)

-- | Attributes of an accelerator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceleratorAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data AcceleratorAttributes
AcceleratorAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> AcceleratorAttributes

-- | The prefix for the location in the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs.
--   Attribute is required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   If you don’t specify a prefix, the flow logs are stored in the root of
--   the bucket. If you specify slash (/) for the S3 bucket prefix, the log
--   file bucket folder structure will include a double slash (//), like
--   the following:
--   
--   s3-bucket_name//AWSLogs/aws_account_id
[$sel:flowLogsS3Prefix:AcceleratorAttributes'] :: AcceleratorAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether flow logs are enabled. The default value is false.
--   If the value is true, <tt>FlowLogsS3Bucket</tt> and
--   <tt>FlowLogsS3Prefix</tt> must be specified.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Flow Logs</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:flowLogsEnabled:AcceleratorAttributes'] :: AcceleratorAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs. Attribute is
--   required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. The bucket must
--   exist and have a bucket policy that grants AWS Global Accelerator
--   permission to write to the bucket.
[$sel:flowLogsS3Bucket:AcceleratorAttributes'] :: AcceleratorAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceleratorAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:flowLogsS3Prefix:AcceleratorAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>acceleratorAttributes_flowLogsS3Prefix</a> - The prefix for the
--   location in the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs. Attribute is
--   required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   If you don’t specify a prefix, the flow logs are stored in the root of
--   the bucket. If you specify slash (/) for the S3 bucket prefix, the log
--   file bucket folder structure will include a double slash (//), like
--   the following:
--   
--   s3-bucket_name//AWSLogs/aws_account_id
--   
--   <a>$sel:flowLogsEnabled:AcceleratorAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>acceleratorAttributes_flowLogsEnabled</a> - Indicates whether flow
--   logs are enabled. The default value is false. If the value is true,
--   <tt>FlowLogsS3Bucket</tt> and <tt>FlowLogsS3Prefix</tt> must be
--   specified.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Flow Logs</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:flowLogsS3Bucket:AcceleratorAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>acceleratorAttributes_flowLogsS3Bucket</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   S3 bucket for the flow logs. Attribute is required if
--   <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. The bucket must exist and
--   have a bucket policy that grants AWS Global Accelerator permission to
--   write to the bucket.
newAcceleratorAttributes :: AcceleratorAttributes

-- | The prefix for the location in the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs.
--   Attribute is required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   If you don’t specify a prefix, the flow logs are stored in the root of
--   the bucket. If you specify slash (/) for the S3 bucket prefix, the log
--   file bucket folder structure will include a double slash (//), like
--   the following:
--   
--   s3-bucket_name//AWSLogs/aws_account_id
acceleratorAttributes_flowLogsS3Prefix :: Lens' AcceleratorAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether flow logs are enabled. The default value is false.
--   If the value is true, <tt>FlowLogsS3Bucket</tt> and
--   <tt>FlowLogsS3Prefix</tt> must be specified.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Flow Logs</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
acceleratorAttributes_flowLogsEnabled :: Lens' AcceleratorAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs. Attribute is
--   required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. The bucket must
--   exist and have a bucket policy that grants AWS Global Accelerator
--   permission to write to the bucket.
acceleratorAttributes_flowLogsS3Bucket :: Lens' AcceleratorAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about an IP address range that is provisioned for use with
--   your AWS resources through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).
--   
--   The following describes each BYOIP <tt>State</tt> that your IP address
--   range can be in.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>PENDING_PROVISIONING</b> — You’ve submitted a request to
--   provision an IP address range but it is not yet provisioned with AWS
--   Global Accelerator.</li>
--   <li><b>READY</b> — The address range is provisioned with AWS Global
--   Accelerator and can be advertised.</li>
--   <li><b>PENDING_ADVERTISING</b> — You’ve submitted a request for AWS
--   Global Accelerator to advertise an address range but it is not yet
--   being advertised.</li>
--   <li><b>ADVERTISING</b> — The address range is being advertised by AWS
--   Global Accelerator.</li>
--   <li><b>PENDING_WITHDRAWING</b> — You’ve submitted a request to
--   withdraw an address range from being advertised but it is still being
--   advertised by AWS Global Accelerator.</li>
--   <li><b>PENDING_DEPROVISIONING</b> — You’ve submitted a request to
--   deprovision an address range from AWS Global Accelerator but it is
--   still provisioned.</li>
--   <li><b>DEPROVISIONED</b> — The address range is deprovisioned from AWS
--   Global Accelerator.</li>
--   <li><b>FAILED_PROVISION</b> — The request to provision the address
--   range from AWS Global Accelerator was not successful. Please make sure
--   that you provide all of the correct information, and try again. If the
--   request fails a second time, contact AWS support.</li>
--   <li><b>FAILED_ADVERTISING</b> — The request for AWS Global Accelerator
--   to advertise the address range was not successful. Please make sure
--   that you provide all of the correct information, and try again. If the
--   request fails a second time, contact AWS support.</li>
--   <li><b>FAILED_WITHDRAW</b> — The request to withdraw the address range
--   from advertising by AWS Global Accelerator was not successful. Please
--   make sure that you provide all of the correct information, and try
--   again. If the request fails a second time, contact AWS support.</li>
--   <li><b>FAILED_DEPROVISION</b> — The request to deprovision the address
--   range from AWS Global Accelerator was not successful. Please make sure
--   that you provide all of the correct information, and try again. If the
--   request fails a second time, contact AWS support.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newByoipCidr</a> smart constructor.
data ByoipCidr
ByoipCidr' :: Maybe ByoipCidrState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ByoipCidrEvent] -> ByoipCidr

-- | The state of the address pool.
[$sel:state:ByoipCidr'] :: ByoipCidr -> Maybe ByoipCidrState

-- | The address range, in CIDR notation.
[$sel:cidr:ByoipCidr'] :: ByoipCidr -> Maybe Text

-- | A history of status changes for an IP address range that you bring to
--   AWS Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).
[$sel:events:ByoipCidr'] :: ByoipCidr -> Maybe [ByoipCidrEvent]

-- | Create a value of <a>ByoipCidr</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ByoipCidr'</a>, <a>byoipCidr_state</a> - The state of
--   the address pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cidr:ByoipCidr'</a>, <a>byoipCidr_cidr</a> - The address
--   range, in CIDR notation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:ByoipCidr'</a>, <a>byoipCidr_events</a> - A history of
--   status changes for an IP address range that you bring to AWS Global
--   Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).
newByoipCidr :: ByoipCidr

-- | The state of the address pool.
byoipCidr_state :: Lens' ByoipCidr (Maybe ByoipCidrState)

-- | The address range, in CIDR notation.
byoipCidr_cidr :: Lens' ByoipCidr (Maybe Text)

-- | A history of status changes for an IP address range that you bring to
--   AWS Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).
byoipCidr_events :: Lens' ByoipCidr (Maybe [ByoipCidrEvent])

-- | A complex type that contains a <tt>Message</tt> and a
--   <tt>Timestamp</tt> value for changes that you make in the status an IP
--   address range that you bring to AWS Global Accelerator through bring
--   your own IP address (BYOIP).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newByoipCidrEvent</a> smart constructor.
data ByoipCidrEvent
ByoipCidrEvent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> ByoipCidrEvent

-- | A string that contains an <tt>Event</tt> message describing changes
--   that you make in the status of an IP address range that you bring to
--   AWS Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).
[$sel:message:ByoipCidrEvent'] :: ByoipCidrEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | A timestamp when you make a status change for an IP address range that
--   you bring to AWS Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address
--   (BYOIP).
[$sel:timestamp:ByoipCidrEvent'] :: ByoipCidrEvent -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>ByoipCidrEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ByoipCidrEvent'</a>, <a>byoipCidrEvent_message</a> - A
--   string that contains an <tt>Event</tt> message describing changes that
--   you make in the status of an IP address range that you bring to AWS
--   Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:ByoipCidrEvent'</a>, <a>byoipCidrEvent_timestamp</a>
--   - A timestamp when you make a status change for an IP address range
--   that you bring to AWS Global Accelerator through bring your own IP
--   address (BYOIP).
newByoipCidrEvent :: ByoipCidrEvent

-- | A string that contains an <tt>Event</tt> message describing changes
--   that you make in the status of an IP address range that you bring to
--   AWS Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).
byoipCidrEvent_message :: Lens' ByoipCidrEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp when you make a status change for an IP address range that
--   you bring to AWS Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address
--   (BYOIP).
byoipCidrEvent_timestamp :: Lens' ByoipCidrEvent (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Provides authorization for Amazon to bring a specific IP address range
--   to a specific AWS account using bring your own IP addresses (BYOIP).
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Bring Your Own IP Addresses (BYOIP)</a>
--   in the <i>AWS Global Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCidrAuthorizationContext</a> smart constructor.
data CidrAuthorizationContext
CidrAuthorizationContext' :: Text -> Text -> CidrAuthorizationContext

-- | The plain-text authorization message for the prefix and account.
[$sel:message:CidrAuthorizationContext'] :: CidrAuthorizationContext -> Text

-- | The signed authorization message for the prefix and account.
[$sel:signature:CidrAuthorizationContext'] :: CidrAuthorizationContext -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CidrAuthorizationContext</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:CidrAuthorizationContext'</a>,
--   <a>cidrAuthorizationContext_message</a> - The plain-text authorization
--   message for the prefix and account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signature:CidrAuthorizationContext'</a>,
--   <a>cidrAuthorizationContext_signature</a> - The signed authorization
--   message for the prefix and account.
newCidrAuthorizationContext :: Text -> Text -> CidrAuthorizationContext

-- | The plain-text authorization message for the prefix and account.
cidrAuthorizationContext_message :: Lens' CidrAuthorizationContext Text

-- | The signed authorization message for the prefix and account.
cidrAuthorizationContext_signature :: Lens' CidrAuthorizationContext Text

-- | Attributes of a custom routing accelerator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingAccelerator</a> smart constructor.
data CustomRoutingAccelerator
CustomRoutingAccelerator' :: Maybe CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [IpSet] -> Maybe Text -> CustomRoutingAccelerator

-- | Describes the deployment status of the accelerator.
[$sel:status:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom routing accelerator.
[$sel:acceleratorArn:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the accelerator is enabled. The value is true or
--   false. The default value is true.
--   
--   If the value is set to true, the accelerator cannot be deleted. If set
--   to false, accelerator can be deleted.
[$sel:enabled:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time that the accelerator was created.
[$sel:createdTime:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time that the accelerator was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The value for the address type must be IPv4.
[$sel:ipAddressType:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | The name of the accelerator. The name must contain only alphanumeric
--   characters or hyphens (-), and must not begin or end with a hyphen.
[$sel:name:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe Text

-- | The static IP addresses that Global Accelerator associates with the
--   accelerator.
[$sel:ipSets:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe [IpSet]

-- | The Domain Name System (DNS) name that Global Accelerator creates that
--   points to your accelerator's static IP addresses.
--   
--   The naming convention for the DNS name is the following: A lowercase
--   letter a, followed by a 16-bit random hex string, followed by
--   .awsglobalaccelerator.com. For example:
--   a1234567890abcdef.awsglobalaccelerator.com.
--   
--   For more information about the default DNS name, see <a>Support for
--   DNS Addressing in Global Accelerator</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:dnsName:CustomRoutingAccelerator'] :: CustomRoutingAccelerator -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingAccelerator</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_status</a> - Describes the deployment
--   status of the accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceleratorArn:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_acceleratorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the custom routing accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_enabled</a> - Indicates whether the
--   accelerator is enabled. The value is true or false. The default value
--   is true.
--   
--   If the value is set to true, the accelerator cannot be deleted. If set
--   to false, accelerator can be deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_createdTime</a> - The date and time that
--   the accelerator was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time
--   that the accelerator was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressType:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_ipAddressType</a> - The value for the
--   address type must be IPv4.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_name</a> - The name of the accelerator.
--   The name must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens (-), and
--   must not begin or end with a hyphen.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipSets:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_ipSets</a> - The static IP addresses that
--   Global Accelerator associates with the accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsName:CustomRoutingAccelerator'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAccelerator_dnsName</a> - The Domain Name System (DNS)
--   name that Global Accelerator creates that points to your accelerator's
--   static IP addresses.
--   
--   The naming convention for the DNS name is the following: A lowercase
--   letter a, followed by a 16-bit random hex string, followed by
--   .awsglobalaccelerator.com. For example:
--   a1234567890abcdef.awsglobalaccelerator.com.
--   
--   For more information about the default DNS name, see <a>Support for
--   DNS Addressing in Global Accelerator</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
newCustomRoutingAccelerator :: CustomRoutingAccelerator

-- | Describes the deployment status of the accelerator.
customRoutingAccelerator_status :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe CustomRoutingAcceleratorStatus)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom routing accelerator.
customRoutingAccelerator_acceleratorArn :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the accelerator is enabled. The value is true or
--   false. The default value is true.
--   
--   If the value is set to true, the accelerator cannot be deleted. If set
--   to false, accelerator can be deleted.
customRoutingAccelerator_enabled :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time that the accelerator was created.
customRoutingAccelerator_createdTime :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time that the accelerator was last modified.
customRoutingAccelerator_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value for the address type must be IPv4.
customRoutingAccelerator_ipAddressType :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | The name of the accelerator. The name must contain only alphanumeric
--   characters or hyphens (-), and must not begin or end with a hyphen.
customRoutingAccelerator_name :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe Text)

-- | The static IP addresses that Global Accelerator associates with the
--   accelerator.
customRoutingAccelerator_ipSets :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe [IpSet])

-- | The Domain Name System (DNS) name that Global Accelerator creates that
--   points to your accelerator's static IP addresses.
--   
--   The naming convention for the DNS name is the following: A lowercase
--   letter a, followed by a 16-bit random hex string, followed by
--   .awsglobalaccelerator.com. For example:
--   a1234567890abcdef.awsglobalaccelerator.com.
--   
--   For more information about the default DNS name, see <a>Support for
--   DNS Addressing in Global Accelerator</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
customRoutingAccelerator_dnsName :: Lens' CustomRoutingAccelerator (Maybe Text)

-- | Attributes of a custom routing accelerator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes
CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes

-- | The prefix for the location in the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs.
--   Attribute is required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   If you don’t specify a prefix, the flow logs are stored in the root of
--   the bucket. If you specify slash (/) for the S3 bucket prefix, the log
--   file bucket folder structure will include a double slash (//), like
--   the following:
--   
--   DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET//AWSLogs/aws_account_id
[$sel:flowLogsS3Prefix:CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes'] :: CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether flow logs are enabled. The default value is false.
--   If the value is true, <tt>FlowLogsS3Bucket</tt> and
--   <tt>FlowLogsS3Prefix</tt> must be specified.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Flow Logs</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:flowLogsEnabled:CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes'] :: CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs. Attribute is
--   required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. The bucket must
--   exist and have a bucket policy that grants AWS Global Accelerator
--   permission to write to the bucket.
[$sel:flowLogsS3Bucket:CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes'] :: CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:flowLogsS3Prefix:CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAcceleratorAttributes_flowLogsS3Prefix</a> - The
--   prefix for the location in the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs.
--   Attribute is required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   If you don’t specify a prefix, the flow logs are stored in the root of
--   the bucket. If you specify slash (/) for the S3 bucket prefix, the log
--   file bucket folder structure will include a double slash (//), like
--   the following:
--   
--   DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET//AWSLogs/aws_account_id
--   
--   <a>$sel:flowLogsEnabled:CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAcceleratorAttributes_flowLogsEnabled</a> - Indicates
--   whether flow logs are enabled. The default value is false. If the
--   value is true, <tt>FlowLogsS3Bucket</tt> and <tt>FlowLogsS3Prefix</tt>
--   must be specified.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Flow Logs</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:flowLogsS3Bucket:CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingAcceleratorAttributes_flowLogsS3Bucket</a> - The name
--   of the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs. Attribute is required if
--   <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. The bucket must exist and
--   have a bucket policy that grants AWS Global Accelerator permission to
--   write to the bucket.
newCustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes :: CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes

-- | The prefix for the location in the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs.
--   Attribute is required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   If you don’t specify a prefix, the flow logs are stored in the root of
--   the bucket. If you specify slash (/) for the S3 bucket prefix, the log
--   file bucket folder structure will include a double slash (//), like
--   the following:
--   
--   DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET//AWSLogs/aws_account_id
customRoutingAcceleratorAttributes_flowLogsS3Prefix :: Lens' CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether flow logs are enabled. The default value is false.
--   If the value is true, <tt>FlowLogsS3Bucket</tt> and
--   <tt>FlowLogsS3Prefix</tt> must be specified.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Flow Logs</a> in the <i>AWS Global
--   Accelerator Developer Guide</i>.
customRoutingAcceleratorAttributes_flowLogsEnabled :: Lens' CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket for the flow logs. Attribute is
--   required if <tt>FlowLogsEnabled</tt> is <tt>true</tt>. The bucket must
--   exist and have a bucket policy that grants AWS Global Accelerator
--   permission to write to the bucket.
customRoutingAcceleratorAttributes_flowLogsS3Bucket :: Lens' CustomRoutingAcceleratorAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | For a custom routing accelerator, sets the port range and protocol for
--   all endpoints (virtual private cloud subnets) in an endpoint group to
--   accept client traffic on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration
CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration' :: Natural -> Natural -> NonEmpty CustomRoutingProtocol -> CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration

-- | The first port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint
--   group that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
[$sel:fromPort:CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration -> Natural

-- | The last port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group
--   that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
[$sel:toPort:CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration -> Natural

-- | The protocol for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom
--   routing accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
[$sel:protocols:CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration -> NonEmpty CustomRoutingProtocol

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromPort:CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingDestinationConfiguration_fromPort</a> - The first
--   port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group that is
--   associated with a custom routing accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toPort:CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingDestinationConfiguration_toPort</a> - The last port,
--   inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group that is
--   associated with a custom routing accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocols:CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingDestinationConfiguration_protocols</a> - The protocol
--   for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom routing
--   accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
newCustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration :: Natural -> Natural -> NonEmpty CustomRoutingProtocol -> CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration

-- | The first port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint
--   group that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
customRoutingDestinationConfiguration_fromPort :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration Natural

-- | The last port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group
--   that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
customRoutingDestinationConfiguration_toPort :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration Natural

-- | The protocol for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom
--   routing accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
customRoutingDestinationConfiguration_protocols :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationConfiguration (NonEmpty CustomRoutingProtocol)

-- | For a custom routing accelerator, describes the port range and
--   protocol for all endpoints (virtual private cloud subnets) in an
--   endpoint group to accept client traffic on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingDestinationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CustomRoutingDestinationDescription
CustomRoutingDestinationDescription' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Protocol] -> Maybe Natural -> CustomRoutingDestinationDescription

-- | The first port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint
--   group that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
[$sel:fromPort:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The protocol for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom
--   routing accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
[$sel:protocols:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationDescription -> Maybe [Protocol]

-- | The last port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group
--   that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
[$sel:toPort:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'] :: CustomRoutingDestinationDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingDestinationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>customRoutingDestinationDescription_fromPort</a> - The first port,
--   inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group that is
--   associated with a custom routing accelerator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocols:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingDestinationDescription_protocols</a> - The protocol
--   for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom routing
--   accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toPort:CustomRoutingDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>customRoutingDestinationDescription_toPort</a> - The last port,
--   inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group that is
--   associated with a custom routing accelerator.
newCustomRoutingDestinationDescription :: CustomRoutingDestinationDescription

-- | The first port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint
--   group that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
customRoutingDestinationDescription_fromPort :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | The protocol for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom
--   routing accelerator. The protocol can be either TCP or UDP.
customRoutingDestinationDescription_protocols :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationDescription (Maybe [Protocol])

-- | The last port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group
--   that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.
customRoutingDestinationDescription_toPort :: Lens' CustomRoutingDestinationDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | The list of endpoint objects. For custom routing, this is a list of
--   virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet IDs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration
CustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> CustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration

-- | An ID for the endpoint. For custom routing accelerators, this is the
--   virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet ID.
[$sel:endpointId:CustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   endpoint. For custom routing accelerators, this is the virtual private
--   cloud (VPC) subnet ID.
newCustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration :: CustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration

-- | An ID for the endpoint. For custom routing accelerators, this is the
--   virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet ID.
customRoutingEndpointConfiguration_endpointId :: Lens' CustomRoutingEndpointConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A complex type for an endpoint for a custom routing accelerator. Each
--   endpoint group can include one or more endpoints, which are virtual
--   private cloud (VPC) subnets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingEndpointDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CustomRoutingEndpointDescription

-- | An ID for the endpoint. For custom routing accelerators, this is the
--   virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet ID.
[$sel:endpointId:CustomRoutingEndpointDescription'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointDescription -> Maybe Text

--   virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet ID.
customRoutingEndpointDescription_endpointId :: Lens' CustomRoutingEndpointDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | A complex type for the endpoint group for a custom routing
--   accelerator. An AWS Region can have only one endpoint group for a
--   specific listener.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingEndpointGroup</a> smart constructor.
data CustomRoutingEndpointGroup
CustomRoutingEndpointGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CustomRoutingEndpointDescription] -> Maybe [CustomRoutingDestinationDescription] -> CustomRoutingEndpointGroup

[$sel:endpointGroupArn:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup -> Maybe Text

--   private cloud subnets) in an endpoint group to accept client traffic
--   on.
[$sel:endpointDescriptions:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup -> Maybe [CustomRoutingEndpointDescription]

--   protocol for all endpoints (virtual private cloud subnets) in an
--   endpoint group to accept client traffic on.
[$sel:destinationDescriptions:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'] :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup -> Maybe [CustomRoutingDestinationDescription]

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingEndpointGroup</a> with all optional

--   where the endpoint group is located.

--   routing accelerator, describes the endpoints (virtual private cloud
--   subnets) in an endpoint group to accept client traffic on.

--   <a>$sel:destinationDescriptions:CustomRoutingEndpointGroup'</a>,

newCustomRoutingEndpointGroup :: CustomRoutingEndpointGroup

-- | A complex type for a listener for a custom routing accelerator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomRoutingListener</a> smart constructor.
data CustomRoutingListener
CustomRoutingListener' :: Maybe (NonEmpty PortRange) -> Maybe Text -> CustomRoutingListener

-- | The port range to support for connections from clients to your
--   accelerator.
--   
--   Separately, you set port ranges for endpoints. For more information,
--   see <a>About endpoints for custom routing accelerators</a>.
[$sel:portRanges:CustomRoutingListener'] :: CustomRoutingListener -> Maybe (NonEmpty PortRange)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.
[$sel:listenerArn:CustomRoutingListener'] :: CustomRoutingListener -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomRoutingListener</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
